abstract.p: Kazakhstan's general prosecutor's office says James Giffen, American trade consultant, has not broken any Kazakh laws and is not under investigation in Kazakhstan; US prosecutors are investigating whether Giffen funneled millions of dollars in payments from major oil companies to Kazakh officials (S)

block.p: James Giffen, an American trade consultant under investigation by United States prosecutors, has not broken any Kazakh laws and is not under investigation in Kazakhstan, the country's general prosecutor's office said. United States prosecutors are investigating whether Mr. Giffen, a consultant to the Kazakh government, funneled millions of dollars in payments from major oil companies to Kazakh officials. In the late 1980's, Mr. Giffen, a lawyer by training, led a coalition of American companies that was set up to form joint ventures in the Soviet Union. More recently, he brokered agreements between the Kazakh government and oil companies.

More recently, he brokered agreements between the Kazakh government and oil companies.
